description: The HpeiLOSecurityParam resource describes the properties for BMC security dashboard parameters.

Description.description: This represents the description of the security configuration.

Ignore.description: This indicates if the security status of the security parameter is set to ignored or not.

IgnoredBy.description: This represents the user who changed the value of Ignore.

IgnoredTime.description: This represents the time when the risk configuration was suppressed.

SecurityStatus.description: This represents if the status of the security parameter.

enumDescriptions.Ok: This indicates no security issue associated with the security parameter.
enumDescriptions.Risk: This indicates a security issue associated with the security parameter.

State.description: This represents the state or value of the security parameter.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: The state of the Security Parameter is Disabled.
enumDescriptions.Enabled: The state of the Security Parameter is Enabled.
enumDescriptions.Failed: The status of the Security Parameter or the result of an operation represented by the Security Parameter is Failed.
enumDescriptions.Insufficient: The value of the Security Parameter is Insufficient or less than the default value.
enumDescriptions.Off: The state of the Security Parameter is Off.
enumDescriptions.Ok: The status of the Security Parameter or the result of an operation represented by the Security Parameter is Ok.
enumDescriptions.On: The state of the Security Parameter is On.
enumDescriptions.Repaired: The state of the Security Parameter is Repaired.
enumDescriptions.True: The state of the Security Parameter is True.
enumDescriptions.False: The state of the Security Parameter is False.

title: #HpeiLOSecurityParam.v1_1_0.HpeiLOSecurityParam
